Package org.hypermedea

Class ThingArtifact

  • java.lang.Object
    • cartago.Artifact
      • org.hypermedea.HypermedeaArtifact
        • org.hypermedea.ThingArtifact
  • public class ThingArtifact
extends HypermedeaArtifact

    A CArtAgO artifact that can interpret a W3C WoT Thing Description (TD) document and expose the affordances (i.e. potential actions) of the described Thing to agents. The artifact uses the hypermedia controls provided in the TD to compose and issue requests for the exposed affordances.

    Operations exposed by a ThingArtifact correspond to the TD operation types:

    • readProperty and writeProperty (for property affordances)
    • invokeAction, queryAction and cancelAction (for action affordances)
    • subscribeEvent(String, Object, OpFeedbackParam) subscribeEvent} and unsubscribeEvent (for event affordances)

    The observeProperty operation that some TDs expose slightly differs from the operation of the same name defined in CArtAgO. Whenever, an agent observes a WoT property with name propertyName, the ThingArtifact exposes these values in observable properties of the form propertyValue(PropertyName, Value).

    Additional operations for authentication are also available.

    To register custom WoT protocol bindings (e.g. for MQTT, OPC UA, ROS, etc.) to all ThingArtifacts, create the file "bindings.txt" in the root folder of your application and declare binding class names as follows (one Java class name per line): 

     org.hypermedea.opcua.OpcUaBinding
 org.hypermedea.ros.ROSBinding
 ...

    See examples/thing, examples/itm-factory and examples/leubot for examples with WoT Things.

        Functor used to advertise that some resource has been created, such as actions or events. For instance, an invokeAction operation may return the result of the action or the URI of a new action resource that can be dereferenced.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init​(java.lang.String urlOrPath)
        Initialize the artifact. The W3C WoT Thing Description (TD) used by this artifact is retrieved and parsed during initialization.
        Parameters:
        urlOrPath - a URL that dereferences to a W3C WoT TD or a path to a local W3C WoT TD, in the Turtle format

      • init

        public void init​(java.lang.String urlOrPath,
                 boolean dryRun)
        See init(String).
        Parameters:
        urlOrPath - a URL that dereferences to a W3C WoT TD or a path to a local W3C WoT TD, in the Turtle format
        dryRun - when set to true, the requests are logged, but not executed

      • readProperty

        public void readProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName)

        Read a property of a Thing by name. The read value is exposed by the ThingArtifact as an observable property. Assume the underlying Thing exposes an affordance for the integer-valued property speedLevel, the read value will be accessible via the observable property speedLevel(12).

        See also readProperty(String, OpFeedbackParam).
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property's name.

      • readProperty

        public void readProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName,
                         cartago.OpFeedbackParam<java.lang.Object> output)

        Read a property of a Thing by name.

        The read value is provided in JSON. For documentation on the mapping between JSON and Jason terms, see org.hypermedea.json.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property's name.
        output - the read value.

      • writeProperty

        public void writeProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName,
                          java.lang.Object payload)

        Write a property of a Thing by name.

        The value to write must be provided in JSON. For documentation on the mapping between JSON and Jason terms, see org.hypermedea.json.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property's name.
        payload - the payload to be issued when writing the property.

      • observeProperty

        public void observeProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName)

        Observe a property of a Thing by name (subscribe to change notifications on the property).

        Note: this method has a distinct behavior from Artifact.observeProperty(String, OpFeedbackParam).

        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property's name (which will also be the name of the observable property created in the Artifact).

      • invokeAction

        public void invokeAction​(java.lang.String actionName,
                         java.lang.Object input,
                         cartago.OpFeedbackParam<java.lang.Object> outputOrURI)

        Invoke an action on a Thing by name. The Thing may either return the output of the action, if executed synchronously, or a link pointing at the URI of the ongoing action, for asynchronous execution. Caller agents may differentiate the two cases as follows:

        • if outputOrURI binds to an atom, a string or a json structure, it is a JSON representation of the action's output as returned by the Thing. For documentation on the mapping between JSON and Jason terms, see org.hypermedea.json.
        • if outputOrURI binds to a resource structure, e.g. resource("http://example.org/actions/123"), the enclosed URI identifies the ongoing action. It may be used as the targetOrVariableBindings parameter of queryAction(String, Object, OpFeedbackParam) or cancelAction(String, Object).

        If the returned value is a URI, that URI

        Parameters:
        actionName - the action's name.
        input - the input payload to be issued when invoking the action as a Jason structure.
        outputOrURI - the output of the action, as provided by the Thing, or the URI of the ongoing action.

      • invokeAction

        public void invokeAction​(java.lang.String actionName,
                         java.lang.Object input)
        Equivalent to invokeAction(actionName, input, null)}.
        Parameters:
        actionName - the action's name.
        input - the input payload to be issued when invoking the action as a Jason structure.

      • invokeAction

        public void invokeAction​(java.lang.String actionName)
        Equivalent to invokeAction(actionName, null, null)}.
        Parameters:
        actionName - the action's name.

      • queryAction

        public void queryAction​(java.lang.String actionName,
                        java.lang.Object targetOrVariableBindings,
                        cartago.OpFeedbackParam<java.lang.Object> status)

        Query the status of an ongoing action performed by the Thing. The action may be addressed either directly (e.g. with the full URI http://example.org/actions/123) or via variables in a URI template (e.g. actionId binding to 123 in the URI template http://example.org/actions/{actionId}). Variable bindings must be given as a JSON object, with variables as keys and bindings as values).

        For documentation on the mapping between JSON and Jason terms, see org.hypermedea.json.

        Parameters:
        actionName - the action's name.
        targetOrVariableBindings - URI of the target action or URI template variable bindings.
        status - the status of the action.

      • queryAction

        public void queryAction​(java.lang.String actionName,
                        cartago.OpFeedbackParam<java.lang.Object> status)
        Equivalent to queryAction(actionName, null, status)}.
        Parameters:
        actionName - the action's name.
        status - the status of the action.

      • cancelAction

        public void cancelAction​(java.lang.String actionName,
                         java.lang.Object targetOrVariableBindings)
        Cancel an ongoing action. As in the queryAction operation, the action may be addressed directly or via URI template variables.
        Parameters:
        actionName - the action's name.
        targetOrVariableBindings - URI of the target action or URI template variable bindings.

      • cancelAction

        public void cancelAction​(java.lang.String actionName)
        Equivalent to cancelAction(actionName, null)}.
        Parameters:
        actionName - the action's name.

      • subscribeEvent

        public void subscribeEvent​(java.lang.String eventName,
                           java.lang.Object subscription,
                           cartago.OpFeedbackParam<java.lang.Object> subscriptionURI)

        Subscribe to an event observed by the Thing. As a result, the Thing is expected to create a subscription resource whose URI is returned if the subscription operation was successful. The URI of the subscription resource is exposed to agents in a resource structure, e.g. resource("http://example.org/subscriptions/abc").

        Any subsequent notification pushed by the Thing is turned into a signal by the ThingArtifact. For instance, if an agent subscribes to the tempAboveThreshold event, which the Thing emits with the latest temperature value it measured, the agent will receive signals such as tempAboveThreshold(36.8). If the Thing pushes notification without payloads, signals are transmitted to agents as plain atoms (e.g. tempAboveThreshold).

        Subscribing to an event may require input data to provide to the Thing. Agents must provide it in JSON via the subscription parameter. Notification payloads are also exposed to agents in JSON. For documentation on the mapping between JSON and Jason terms, see org.hypermedea.json.

        Parameters:
        eventName - the event's name.
        subscription - the payload to be issued to the Thing when subscribing to the event
        subscriptionURI - a structure enclosing the URI of the active subscription returned by the Thing.

      • subscribeEvent

        public void subscribeEvent​(java.lang.String eventName)
        Equivalent to subscribeEvent(eventName, null, null).
        Parameters:
        eventName -

      • unsubscribeEvent

        public void unsubscribeEvent​(java.lang.String eventName,
                             java.lang.String targetOrVariableBindings,
                             java.lang.Object cancellation)
        Cancel an active subscription to the event. The subscription may be addressed directly or via URI template variables. See queryAction(String, Object, OpFeedbackParam) for a similar interface.
        Parameters:
        eventName - the event's name.
        targetOrVariableBindings - URI of the target subscription or URI template variable bindings.
        cancellation - cancellation data to provide to the Thing.

      • unsubscribeEvent

        public void unsubscribeEvent​(java.lang.String eventName,
                             java.lang.String targetOrVariableBindings)
        Equivalent to unsubscribeEvent(eventName, targetOrVariableBindings, null).
        Parameters:
        eventName - the event's name.
        targetOrVariableBindings - URI of the target subscription or URI template variable bindings.
